revisions.rev:
{{Use dmy dates|date=October 2011}} {{Use British English|date=October 2011}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = The Eyes of a Traitor | image = | alt = | caption = | image_size = | background = group_or_band | years_active = 2006–2011 (Hiatus) | alias = | origin = [[Harpenden]], [[Hertfordshire]], United Kingdom | genre = [[Metalcore]], {{nowrap|[[melodic death metal]]}} | label = [[Listenable Records]]
[[Doom Patrol Foundation|Doom Patrol]] | associated_acts = Heart In Hand | website = {{URL|http://www.theeyesofatraitor.com/}} | current_members = Jack Delany
Tim George
Matthew Pugh
Jack Moulsdale
Sam Brennan | Former_members = Paul Waudby
David McCretton
Ian Cubbon
Stephen Whitworth }} '''The Eyes of a Traitor''' are a British [[metalcore]] band from [[Harpenden]] in [[Hertfordshire]], UK, who formed in the summer of 2006.{{cite web|url = http://www.metalunderground.com/news/details.cfm?newsid=36193| title = The Eyes Of A Traitor Signs To Listenable Records| author = deathbringer | publisher = Metal Underground.com| date = 28/04/2008| accessdate = 06/09/2010}} They have released two extended plays, and two full-length studio albums. The band consists of vocalist Jack Delany, guitarists Tim George and Matthew Pugh, bassist Jack Moulsdale and drummer Sam Brennan. The bands name apparently devirves from a conversation the band members had whilst watching Star Wars. There have been numerous line-up changes within the band, mainly due to members wishing to pursue education. They released their debut EP [[By Sunset]] in November 2007 after being recorded and writted it in 2006. This was followed up by [[A Clear Perception]] being released on [[Listenable Records]] in 2009. Their second studio album, [[Breathless (The Eyes of a Traitor album)|Breathless]], was released in July 2010 after featuring a different line-up, maintaining only the vocalist and drummer of the band as original members. They then released a second extended play titled [[The Disease EP|The Disease]] independently, through live shows. Eyes of a Traitor was in the process of recording their third studio album; however declared their hiatus on 20 November 2011. ==History== ===Formation and A Clear Perception (2006–2009)=== The band formed in August 2006 when vocalist Jack Delany and guitarist Stephen Whitworth first met in Luton. A year after their formation, they parted ways with their bassist, Ian Cubbon due to musical differences. Releasing their first extended play, [[By Sunset]] on underground UK label [[Thirty Days of Night Records|Thirty Days of Night]] led to them touring across the country. Their first tour was a 7 day UK tour in support of Italian [[blackened death metal]] band Godless Crusade. In the winter of 2007, The Eyes of a Traitor did a headline tour with death metal act Aortic Dissection, leading to them being acknowledged by Listenable Records. This subsequently led to the signing of a 3 album deal with Listenable Records. Guitarist David McCretton left the band at this time to further his education and was replaced by an old friend of the band, Matthew Pugh.{{cite web|url = http://www.listenable.net/v2/artist_detail.php?id=63| title = The Eyes Of A Traitor's band page on Listenable Records| author = | publisher = [[Listenable Records]]| date =| accessdate = 06/09/2010}} On February 6, 2009, The Eyes of a Traitor were confirmed as main support for Gojira on the UK dates of their "The Way of All Flesh Tour." {{cite web|url = http://www.bravewords.com/news/106235| title = THE EYES OF A TRAITOR Announced As Main Support To GOJIRA On Upcoming UK Tour| author = | publisher = Bravewords.com| date = 06/02/2009 | accessdate = }} The tour was in conjunction with the release of their debut album [[A Clear Perception]]. Shortly after the Gojira tour, The Eyes of a Traitor embarked on a 7 day headline tour with The Argent Dawn, Many Things Untold and Ignominious Incarceration. This was the start of a massive tour schedule which was to occupy them for the remainder of the year. On September 1, 2009, The Eyes of a Traitor released a digital single called Nothing to Offer.{{cite web|url =http://blogs.myspace.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=blog.view&friendId=101855470&blogId=505719745| title = The Nothing To Offer Single Myspace Blog|work= The Eyes of a Traitor|publisher=[[MySpace]]| date = August 16, 2009 }} This was later re-recorded for their second album ''[[Breathless (The Eyes of a Traitor album)|Breathless]]''. ===Breathless and The Disease (2010–present)=== On 18 January 2010, Paul Waudby announced that he would be leaving the band in pursuit of a career outside of the music industry. With the band due to go into the studio two weeks later, Jack Moulsdale, both a close friend and tech support of the band stood in to become their new bassist.{{cite web|url = http://blogs.myspace.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=blog.view&friendId=101855470&blogId=526342495| title = PAUL WAUDBY LEAVES/JACK MOULSDALE JOINS, Myspace Blog|work= The Eyes of a Traitor| publisher = [[MySpace]]| date = 18/01/2010 | accessdate = 06/09/2010}} With the release of their second studio album in July 2010, Breathless, the band toured across the United Kingdom and Continental Europe extensively, joining [[The Chariot (band)|The Chariot's]] European headline tour with [[Iwrestledabearonce]] starting April 9 and extending till May 9, 2010. On June 27 they appeared at [[Ghostfest#Ghostfest_2010|Ghostfest 2010]] on the monster energy stage alongside [[Gallows (band)|Gallows]], [[Devil Sold His Soul]] and [[Lower than Atlantis]]. Later in the year, on 18 September 2010 on their Facebook page, The Eyes of a Traitor revealed that they would release an EP consisting of 4 re-recorded tracks from their debut album: Under Siege, Escape These Walls, Like Clockwork and The Impact of Two Hearts.{{cite web|url = http://www.facebook.com/home.php?#!/traitorUK?v=wall&story_fbid=163986870280368| title = So the tracks to...|work= The Eyes of a Traitor|publisher = [[Facebook]]| date = 5 October, 2010| accessdate = 5 October, 2010 |quote= So the tracks to come are Under Siege, Escape These Walls, Like Clockwork and The Impact of Two Hearts. We hope you enjoy them, they'll be ready in just over a weeks time. Under Siege in drop A? oh my.}} It was origonally announced to be released around christmas time but was delayed indefinatly. Justin Lowe, the guitarist of metalcore band [[After the burial]] mixed the tracks while Ed Sokolowski produced them. Progress on the completion on the EP was hindered because of After the Burial touring with [[As I Lay Dying (band)|As I Lay Dying]].{{cite web|url = http://www.facebook.com/?ref=logo#!/traitorUK/posts/10150413350625543|title = getting the 1st mix...|work= The Eyes of a Traitor| publisher = [[Facebook]]| date = 24 February, 2011|accessdate= 29 April 2011 |quote= Getting the 1st mix back from Justin this week! Sorry for the delay the man is on tour with As I Lay Dying I'm sure you can let him off}} On 16 September, 2011 embarked on a short tour across the United Kingdom with Heart in Hand and Martyr Defiled. Although the tour only ended on September 23, the band used this tour to promote their new extended play "[[The Disease EP]]". The EP was limited to 200 copies, in promotion, the title track âDiseaseâ became avaliable to stream in conjunction with the announcement.{{cite web|url =http://www.metalhammer.co.uk/news/the-eyes-of-traitor-release-ep-and-stream-single/|title= The Eyes Of A Traitor Release EP And Stream Single!|author = Gill, James|publisher = [[Metal Hammer]]|date = 16 August 2011| accessdate = 27 September 2011}} On 9 November 2011 the EP was made free by the band.{{cite web|url=http://www.frontarmy.com/news/download-the-eyes-of-a-traitors-now-ep-for-free/|title=DOWNLOAD THE EYES OF A TRAITORâS NEW EP FOR FREE|author = |publisher = [[Front Magazine]]|date = 9 November 2011| accessdate = 10 November 2011}} It was stated on November 20th, 2011, on The Eyes of a Traitors Facebook page that they are taking a break as a band. ==Musical style and influences== Founding and former guitarist Steve Whitworth, when asked how he would describe the band's sound, said that they "combine technicality with melodic sensibilities, metal and occasional sprinklings from other genres." {{cite web|url =http://www.metalunderground.com/news/details.cfm?newsid=42283 | title = Interview with The Eyes of a Traitor's Steve Whitworth|author = Pamela Porosky|publisher = Metalunderground|date = 13/02/2009| accessdate =21/07/2010}} The Eyes of a Traitor have been described by critics as [[metalcore]], [[melodic death metal]], experimental thrash{{cite web|url = http://www.bravewords.com/news/123130| title = THE EYES OF A TRAITOR To Tour Europe In December| author = | publisher = Brave Words & Bloody Knuckles| date = 01/10/2009}}{{cite web|url = http://www.metalhammer.co.uk/news/the-eyes-of-a-traitor-uk-tour-dates/| title = The Eyes Of A Traitor UK Tour Dates| author = James Gill| publisher = Metal Hammer| date = 02/11/2010 }} and progressive metal. They have been described by critics as "math metal" which shows their music's close proxmitity to [[mathcore]] but retaining more metallic elements. Many critics have has credited them for their accelerated progression through the British metal scene considering the age of the band members. By the time [[By Sunset|their first EP]] was released, the average age of the members was 17.{{cite web|url = http://www.bravewords.com/news/87177| title = THE EYES OF A TRAITOR Ink Deal With Listenable Records |author = |publisher = Bravewords.com|date = 2009-04-11}} A Clear Perception shown that despite mixed overall ratings of the album by critics, the band wes praised for their attempts to bring something new to deathcore. With their use of clean vocals and "...treading the line between metalcore and deathcore, adding elements of the Gothenburg [[melodic death metal]] into their sound to good effect.".{{cite web|url = http://www.ultimate-guitar.com/reviews/compact_discs/the_eyes_of_the_traitor/a_clear_perception/index.html| title = A Clear Perception Review The Eyes Of A Traitor Compact Discs Reviews| author = | publisher = Ultimate Guitar| date = 12 November 2009|accessdate = 27 September 2011}}{{cite web|url = http://www.sputnikmusic.com/album.php?albumid=34416| title = The Eyes Of A Traitor - A Clear Perception (album review)|author = |publisher = [[sputnikmusic]]|date = 14 February 2009 |accessdate = 27 September 2011}} Members of the band have said they are influenced by [[technical death metal]] acts such as [[Gojira]], [[Textures (band)|Textures]] and [[Necrophagist]], as well as bands such as [[Children Of Bodom]], [[Slipknot (band)|Slipknot]], [[Misery Signals]], [[Mesuggah]], [[In Flames]], and [[Thrice]].{{cite web|url =http://absolutepunk.net/showthread.php?p=84207422#post84207422 | title = Eyes of a Traitor, The - 01.18.11 - Interview - Absolutepunk.net|author = Jenny Tate|publisher = Absolutepunk|date = January 28, 2011| accessdate =04/05/2011}} ==Band members== ;Current members * Jack Delany – [[Lead vocalist|lead vocals]] (2006âpresent) * Matthew Pugh – [[guitarist]] (2008âpresent) * Tim George – guitarist (2010âpresent) * Jack Moulsdale – [[bass guitar]] (2010âpresent) * Sam Brennan – [[Drum kit|drums]], [[Percussion instrument|percussion]] (2006âpresent) ;Former members * Stephen Whitworth – guitar (2006â2010) * Paul Waudby – bass (2007â2010) * David McCretton – guitar (2006â2008) * Ian Cubbon – bass (2006â2007) ==Discography== ;Studio albums * ''[[A Clear Perception]]'' (2009) * ''[[Breathless (The Eyes of a Traitor album)|Breathless]]'' (2010) ;Extended plays * ''[[By Sunset]]'' (2007) * ''[[The Disease EP]]'' (2011) * ''Clear Your Perception'' (TBA) ;Singles * ''Nothing to Offer'' (2009) * ''Come To My Senses'' (2010) ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *{{myspace|theeyesofatraitor|The Eyes of a Traitor}} *{{facebook|traitorUK|The Eyes of a Traitor}} {{The Eyes of a Traitor}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Eyes Of A Traitor}} [[Category:British metalcore musical groups]] [[Category:Deathcore musical groups]] [[Category:English melodic death metal musical groups]] [[Category:Musical quintets]] [[Category:Musical groups established in 2006]]
